event: admitted for workup of anemia and weight loss
gradual, painless decline in vision of both eyes
no previous history of eye trauma
no previous history of eye surgery
deep and quiet anterior chamber right eye
iris pigments on surface of lens left eye
ordered systemic work-up for infectious and inflammatory etiologies
no subretinal infiltrate on B-Scan ultrasonography
poor view fundus photos and fluorescein angiography due to cataract
floating cells in anterior chamber on ultrasound biomicroscopy
atypical lymphoid cells in aqueous fluid
immunohistochemical staining consistent with T-cell lymphoma
flow cytometry analysis positive for CD5, CD3, CD2, CD8, CD56
aberrant loss of CD4 and CD7
no expression of CD10 and CD34
alpha and beta T-cell receptor positive
postoperative visual acuity counting fingers at 3 feet both eyes
reforming pinkish hypopyon left anterior chamber
hazy view right fundus exam due to cataract
ordered radiologic investigations by oncology team
unremarkable chest x-ray for tuberculosis or sarcoidosis
large heterogeneous left adrenal mass on CT CAP
ultrasound guided biopsy of adrenal mass
atypical lymphoid cells with blastoid features in adrenal biopsy
recommended PET scan of brain and orbit
PET scan brain and orbit showing increased uptake in right nasal and ethmoidal sinuses
PET scan pelvis showing high uptake in scrotum and testicles
local radiotherapy added to treatment plan
deterioration after two cycles of chemotherapy
stabilized and transferred to Medical Intensive Care Unit
advanced trauma life support protocols started
